Description: Body sherd of Attic pottery Droop cup; interior glazed black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of cock, painted 'upside-down' (part of tail feathers missing) between black bands and lines; below, tips of rays.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the style, see Moore and Pease Philippides in 'The Athenian Agora xxiii. Attic Black-Figured Pottery', 1986, no. 1747.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 90 no. 307 pl. 67)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 428, no. B681, pl. XXVIII, pl. CCIX)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1409) (phase 3)
